title.narrative: Enhancing Programme Quality and Inclusion in Crisis Response

description.narrative: In a world increasingly shaped by global challenges – rapid population growth and urbanization, persistent poverty and growing socioeconomic inequalities, political tensions, violence and conflict, natural disasters and climate change, gender-based violence and other forms of human rights violations – more and more people are forced to be on the move. IOM plays a unique role in responding to the needs of people exposed and vulnerable to the impact of these global challenges. Central to its response to these needs is the Organization’s migration mandate, its flexible and strong operational character, and its role as a humanitarian responder. Through this project, IOM’s Department of Operations and Emergencies (DOE) actively seeks to promote integrated programming and responses that lead to long term impacts and, as such, the department is taking active steps to integrate programming at its Headquarters and aims to increase its capacity to support field operations in doing the same. This will be backed up by a global network of Regional Thematic Specialists with a focus on emergency and postcrisis operations.
